title: Fiesta Mexicana
content:
Hello,

What is the font for “Fiesta Mexicana?”

Thank you

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Fiesta Mexicana.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080511225240/http:/typophile.com/files/Fiesta%20Mexicana.jpg) | 48.69 KB |

 [‹ (x) Molitoris slanted serif on business card - Adobe Serif {Yves, J. Edward Sanchez}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080511225240/http:/www.typophile.com/node/21395 "Go to previous forum topic") ["Goldfinger" movie poster font please help... ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080511225240/http:/www.typophile.com/node/21425 "Go to next forum topic")
author: misalion

comments.content:
Looks like Davida to me. I’ll find the link.

- Lex

[Davida](http://web.archive.org/web/20080511225240/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=UR.109791.0.1&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=FIESTA+MEXICANA&sampleSize=48) is not an exact match. This could be a font “inspired” by Davida.

- Lex

Predigital VGC Davida had alternates - like the A and E as seen in the image. The X in the font shown at Fontshop is backwards (now how does THAT happen?)!

Stephen - I can’t find the selling foundry anywhere on the page Lex that links to (we know it ain’t VGC). Just a heads up. In fact, I see now that only when you do a Search on a name and get the choices are the selling foundries shown. Beyond that they are AWOL.

Edit: The Linotype and Bitstream versions have the correct X.
